text: makeshift ambulances brought them in
this morning as cobbles hospitals were
overwhelmed at least 80 people killed
when a huge truck bomb exploded during
rush hours several hundred people were
injured it is one of the worst bomb
attacks in Afghanistan in years quite a
lot of them I heard a terrible sound and
became unconscious I opened my eyes and
found myself under the desk blood was
coming out of my shoulder it was a
dreadful explosion this video taken
miles from the blast shows how powerful
it was the BBC's hadronyche okasada has
been at the scene it was a water tanker
or an lorry full of explosives that had
this is traffic location right in the
heart of Kabul it's very close to the
German embassy Indian embassy French and
British embassies the explosion only a
short distance from Afghanistan's
presidential palace this is the German
Embassy today badly damaged the other
minor Germany's foreign minister said
the unimaginable death toll was proof
that terror continues to target Western
institutions but also local people I saw
a book a BBC team were in the area and
hit by the blast
killing driver Mohamed Nazir the BBC
described him as a popular colleague
with a young family NATO and some
British troops are still based in
Afghanistan but the fact that militants
were able to get such a large bomb into
the cities heavily guarded political
zone shows how fragile Afghanistan's
security picture has become so far
neither the Taliban nor the so-called
Islamic state in Afghanistan had claimed
responsibility attacks in Kabul are not
unusual but this was a bombing on
another scale among the dead women and
children
Tom barrage BBC News
